item.title: Carrie Thompson
item.dc:creator: Eliza Quarnberg
item.content:encoded:
CARRIE THOMPSON

DIRECTOR OF ADMISSIONS & BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT

CREDENTIALS
  • Bachelor of Psychology, Middlebury College, Middlebury, Vermont
PROFESSIONAL

Carrie began her career working at a therapeutic boarding school in 2001. Watching young men and women gain insight and maturity while preparing for the next steps in their lives inspired Carrie to seek further career opportunities in the mental health field. The passion people possess once they can get a handle on their challenges is unmatched. Transitioning into a role as Admissions Director in 2004 was a natural move for Carrie. Being able to follow families from the first phone call all the way through to graduation is inspiring and fulfilling.  In 2012, excited by the opportunity to work with a unique population and with a well-respected and energetic team, Carrie accepted a job as Director of Admissions at a prestigious residential treatment center, where she remained until 2017. Carrie is a member of the inaugural director team at Bridge House and is energized to be a part of this unique and innovative approach to assessment and treatment planning, the backbone to any successful outcome in mental health care.  Carrie believes in a transparent and open admission process where all questions are fair game and decisions are explained with utmost clarity.

PERSONAL

After growing up in Park City, Utah, Carrie headed East for college, where she competed nationally as a swimmer while studying psychology. Although she loved her time in Vermont, Carrie’s love of western skylines, ski slopes, and bike trails lured her back to Utah.  Carrie likes to stay active and cherishes time with friends, family, and her daughter, born in 2015. Attending live music performances & practicing yoga is how Carrie likes to spend her free time when she is not on her bike or skis.

HOPE, HEALTH & HEALING

Human beings are inherently resilient. Despite what families and individuals have been through before seeking mental health treatment, the outcomes and potential for health, hope, and healing are what keep Carrie coming back to work each day.  When people are treated with compassion and respect through the treatment process, families can look back fondly with pride and honor for all that was accomplished.

 Working in Mental Health Since 2001

Working at Bridge House Since 2017

item.title: Katie Pettey
item.dc:creator: Eliza Quarnberg
item.content:encoded:
KATIE PETTEY, SHRM-SCP, SPHR

DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES

CREDENTIALS
  • Senior Professional in Human Resources: HR Certification Institute
  • Senior Certified HR Professional: Society of Human Resource Management
  • Bachelor of Science: Geography: Travel & Tourism, Brigham Young University, Provo, Utah
PROFESSIONAL

Katie’s diverse professional experience has been an asset to Bridge House since its inception. She’s had experience in media relations, sales & marketing, CRM management, human resources, and more! Katie enjoyed her work in the tourism industry, which included the Director of Tourism for Salt Lake. She has also found great satisfaction in helping others through her own professional organizing business. Her introduction to the mental health field came as she worked as the Operations Manager for a psychological evaluation transcription company, allowing her to interface with countless psychologists and mental health professionals. At Bridge House, she oversees the development and management of office systems. She maintains compliance standards and employee relations, training, recruiting, compensation, benefits, and supporting the overall goals of each department at Bridge House. Katie is a member of the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM) and the Northern Utah Human Resources Association (NUHRA).

PERSONAL

Katie is a Utah native and enjoys playing in the outdoors with her husband, four boys, and dog.  She loves to stay active in the mountains and deserts year-round.  She also loves helping family and friends organize their spaces.

HOPE, HEALTH & HEALING

Everyone deserves the opportunity to find and be their best selves.  Identifying and removing the obstacles that stand in the way of our own improvement can be challenging, revealing, and rewarding all at the same time.  When we surround ourselves with the right support, progress and growth are not only possible but inevitable.

Working in healthcare since 2003

Working at Bridge House since 2017

item.title: Eliza Quarnberg
item.dc:creator: Eliza Quarnberg
item.content:encoded:
ELIZA QUARNBERG

ADMISSIONS ASSOCIATE

CREDENTIALS
  • Certified Life Coach
  • Trauma Informed Care Certification
PROFESSIONAL

Eliza started her mental health-based career in 2010. As an overnight employee at a residential treatment center for teenage girls, she discovered her passion for supporting individuals struggling with mental health challenges. Throughout her time in the field, she has gained invaluable experience as a Certified Life Coach, teaching adolescents and young adults the life skills they need based on Dialectical Behavior Therapy and Cognitive Behavior Therapy models. Before accepting the Admissions Associate position at Bridge House, Eliza spent seven years working in various leadership roles and eventually obtained a background in writing and overseeing a local Transitional Living Program. This opportunity provided her with a Certification in Trauma-Informed Care. It commissioned her with tasks such as managing and training her program’s staff, conferring treatment strategies with education consultants, and providing goal-oriented support for residents and their families. This provided her with first-hand experience in helping those trying to find the right help for their loved ones.  Her previous experience allows her to meet with prospective families and guide them through selecting Bridge House for their journey in recovery. 

PERSONAL

Eliza was born and raised in Utah. After high school, she traveled abroad to Jinan, China, where she spent 6-months teaching young school children. China’s vibrant and historical culture ignited a love of traveling and cultural pursuit in her. Additionally, Eliza enjoys various activities such as painting, playing the piano, gardening, beekeeping, hiking, gaming, and exploring Utah’s unique adventure destinations. Eliza is an active member of the chameleon community and dedicates a lot of her time mentoring others on proper husbandry and care for these fascinating animals. Above all else, Eliza enjoys spending quality time with her beautiful family.

HOPE, HEALTH & HEALING

Eliza believes the road for recovery is paved with human connection, self-care, and a supportive, positive environment.

Working in Mental Health Since 2010

Working at Bridge House Since 2021

item.title: Carol Cook
item.dc:creator: Eliza Quarnberg
item.content:encoded:
CAROL COOK

ASSISTANT PROGRAM DIRECTOR

CREDENTIALS
  • Bachelor of Science in Psychology, Weber State University, Utah
PROFESSIONAL

Carol started her career in the mental health field as a psych tech at Bridge House in 2017. Over the past several years at Bridge House, she has held several positions, including floor manager, aegis instructor, and scheduling coordinator. Carol is now providing care to our residents by stepping into the Bridge House in the Assistant Program Director role. Carol is passionate about working with people and helping them develop and grow their leadership skills. She loves teaching about the importance of relationships and communication. She believes these skills are the foundation for helping individuals at Bridge House feel valued, heard, and, most importantly, understood. Carol is currently working on her master’s degree in clinical mental health counseling.

PERSONAL

Carol loves to spend time with her husband and two beautiful children. As a family, they enjoy traveling together and have especially enjoyed time exploring South America and Europe. Carol’s other hobbies include hiking, camping, riding motorcycles, reading, and in nature with her three dogs.

HOPE, HEALTH & HEALING

Carol believes that when an individual feels connected, cared for, and safe, they are able to start their path to healing. She believes that mental health is an internal part of our well-being, and when we are in an environment that promotes connection and safety, we can regain hope for a better life and a better future.

Working in health care since 2017

Working at Bridge House since 2017

item.title: Kate Morris
item.dc:creator: Eliza Quarnberg
item.content:encoded:
Kate Morris

OFFICE MANAGER

CREDENTIALS
  • Level 3 Excel Certified
  • Doula
  • CNA
  • Certified Employee Relations & Employee Life Cycle
  • Certified Organizational Ethics with Mirco HR
PROFESSIONAL

Kate has worked at Bridge House as a medical technician, floor manager, Aegis instructor, and human resource assistant. Through these many roles, she has learned a lot about the Bridge House process. She understands the importance of intentional relationship building and doing so in a way that best supports the growth of those we care for here. Through her years of working here at Bridge House, she has seen its positive impact on so many individuals who felt they had no other options left.

PERSONAL

Kate loves the outdoors. She can be found hiking and camping around Utah and exploring national parks with her family. Outdoor concerts are a weekly part of her summer evenings, where she can get out and listen to live music. She was born and raised in Utah and currently resides in Davis County. She enjoys supporting and teaching women through the phases of pregnancy and postpartum and works as a Doula in her spare time.

HOPE, HEALTH & HEALING

Kate believes that hope, health, and healing are essential keys to moving through life on your best path. Life can get messy, but with these key elements, it can all seem a bit more manageable to keep striving for the best version of yourself.

Working in Mental Health since 2018

Working at Bridge House since 2018
